If you mean can you view trade history you made in BarterDEX in HyperDEX then no you can't
They use the same `marketmaker` daemon but are completely isolated instances

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you do a withdraw to yourself, the change output is merged to the last output value

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it might be that an extra output of 0.0001 would be needed to be the one to be merged into

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: eg. input 1 output 0.01 -> change 0.99 -> notices it is the same destination and merges to a single output

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: minimizing utxo explosion is the reason for this

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content:
@Deleted User 
>I was trying to generate a BCH sell order, for 0.01 BCH.
>HyperDEX generated utxo for 0.1 instead.

Btw, HyperDEX has nothing to do with selecting the UTXOs for the sell orders or withdrawals. We just pass the parameters you set to `marketmaker` it and will place an order as close as it can to what you requested based on the UTXOs available. So this is `marketmaker` behaviour, unrelated to the GUI. The same issue will likely occur with the BarterDEX GUI or using the CLI

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: So if you want to open an issue to track this, best to open an issue on the SuperNET repo

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content:
Can you try going to `Debug > Show App Data` and move that entire folder somewhere
It's very important you don't delete it if you have already been using HyperDEX as it'll contain your encrypted seeds and trade history, just move it somewhere safe, and we can try and move it back later.
If you haven't done any trades or deposited any funds you can just delete it

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: then try re-opening the app

Author: 7rank#9952
Content: @yugyug @lukechilds I had the same issue as yugyug.  Exact error stated... I did what you suggested and was able to log in.  What are the next steps to restore original keys?

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: do you have swap history?

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: or you only need the keys

Author: 7rank#9952
Content: @lukechilds just wanted to reinstate previous portfolio as I transferred some funds there

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: So if you don't care about trade history, only the seed (funds), you can simple copy the portfolio folder from the backup you took into the new app data folder

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: restart the app and it will list your previous portfolios and allow you to log in

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: you will need to re-enable any non default currencies

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: and it won't have your trade history

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: but any funds you had will be there

Author: JackLeFou#3655
Content: Hi all, is HyperDEX a GUI for BarterDEX or is something different?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: they both use the same back end.

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
`is HyperDEX a GUI for BarterDEX or is something different?`
‚òùüèø  Every reason that I've always said that the reference GUI and the system as a whole shouldn't share the same name

Author: JackLeFou#3655
Content: @blackjok3r @ComputerGenie you two answer in all the rooms XD Thanks guys, I'm sorry for all these questions but I'm writing a section of a report on Komodo and I don't want to write bs ^^

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: @JackLeFou The trade system has been called BarterDEX and the 1st major reference GUI bears the same name; HyperDEX in an alternative GUI

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: One of the main differences between the GUIs is that HyperDEX focuses on lite/SPV mode and "BarterDEX GUI" was designed to be a full reference implementation (meaning that it has "everything but the kitchen sink" in it)

Author: JackLeFou#3655
Content: Ok, now it's clear! Thanks you again üòÉ

Author: JackLeFou#3655
Content: in fact calls the trading system and the GUI in the same way is pretty confusing

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: well, that happens from time to time when projects start out

Author: JackLeFou#3655
Content: yes it's normal, not a big issue anyway
